Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory347.jpg

Who can doubt that in times to come, when the true history of my famous deeds comes to light, the wise man who compiles them, when he begins to recount my first sally so early in the day, will write in this manner—

No sooner had rubicund Apollo spread over the face of the wide and spacious earth the golden strands of his beauteous hair, no sooner had diminutive and bright-hued birds with dulcet tongues greeted in sweet, mellifluous harmony the advent of rosy dawn...
...who, forsaking the soft couch of her zealous consort, revealed herself to mortals through the doors and balconies of the Manchegan horizon, than the famous knight...
Flipping the page, he finds the rest of the notebook blank, the rough pencil marks coming to an end. The fate of the notebook's owner is unknown, much like the rest of the story transcribed.

Roland turns around and looks at the scorched earth behind him. Perhaps a group of Hetero-Creatures or some powerful Corrupted swept across this crimson land, destroying everything but this small notebook.
Finding a burnt tree trunk, Roland sits down and tears off a piece of blank paper from the book. After some thought, he quietly places a small object above the paper before folding it...
A girl walks out of the shadow, curious about how Roland keeps folding the paper in his hand.
Cinderelik
What are you doing?
Roland smiles and gives the paper one final press before standing it up on a burnt branch in front of him—it is an origami rabbit.
Roland
Can't you tell...? It's a rabbit. Do you know what a rabbit is?
Cinderelik looks at the paper bunny and frowns.
Cinderelik
I know what it is, but is this a rabbit...?
Roland
I think I did a pretty good job. It's small and white with big eyes and long ears... Isn't it adorable?
Cinderelik
Adorable... How can a creature so weak be adorable? I don't understand why you made it.
Roland stands up from his tree trunk and stretches.
Roland
Maybe... I was bored.
Cinderelik has no idea what the man before her is thinking, but she does not need to know. It was Mister's idea to keep him with them, and Mister is never wrong.
Cinderelik
Mister is looking for you. Come... He told me it's your reward.
Roland's gaze shifts just a little bit, his expression remaining the same as if he is performing the role he has always been playing with ease—someone whose thought is inscrutable.
Roland
Oh? Well, then, I should probably go and claim it quickly.
Following Cinderelik, Roland takes one last look at the origami rabbit on the branch before he departs this wasteland, and he retracts his mocking smile.
Roland
I'm counting on you... "Lady White Rabbit".
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory536.jpg
Cinderelik
Mister... I've brought him here.
The man facing away from Cinderelik is looking at the night sky, seemingly deep in thought. Hearing her, he nods and turns around.
Roland
Hello, Mr. Vonnegut. It seems like you haven't forgotten our deal.
Vonnegut
Of course not. A fair exchange is key to any partnership. Your work has earned you your reward.
Roland smiles and gives Vonnegut a gentleman's bow.
Roland

Don't mention it. It was what I do best... Still, I can't help but wonder about the two... monsters created by the Hetero-Hive Mother. It took so much effort, but Babylonia's new weapon seems to have kept them at bay.
Vonnegut
That is arguably the best answer humans can come up with given how desperate they are... After all, they do possess an ace up their sleeve.
Vonnegut looks at Roland, awaiting his reaction.
Roland
Ha... so they do have Luna with them. That would explain why they didn't kill her. The secrets one can learn from an agent are too valuable.
Vonnegut
But they certainly haven't learned all of them. Otherwise, they wouldn't have created that imperfect Construct—but the more they learn, the closer they are to their demise.
Roland shrugs, unconcerned. He leans on a random tree that looks steady enough, asking the question he cares about the most while pretending to be indifferent.
Roland
So—our dearest Luna... Where is she?
Vonnegut seems to have expected Roland's question, and he has an answer prepared.
Vonnegut
Luna is kept by humans in a place we can see but cannot touch.
Roland
What is that? A riddle...? Sigh. I wasn't expecting you to make it difficult for me... Wait a minute...
Roland quickly realizes that what Vonnegut said was not a riddle but a fact—a fact Roland sees every day but ignores.
Roland looks to the sky. The Moon shines, casting light on his face.
Roland
The Moon... Luna is on the Moon?
Pleased, Vonnegut nods and turns his gaze toward the Moon as well.
Vonnegut
She is currently locked inside Babylonia's lunar base. It was once a research center for Babylonia's main engine.
Vonnegut
And now, people have restarted the zero-point reactor there, using it to create the "Omega Weapons" that are lethal to the Punishing Virus.
Roland rubs his chin and ponders. He glances toward Cinderelik on the side and smirks, having come up with an idea.
Roland
I don't know how you find out about this information, and I have no way to prove it. If you say Luna was under the Mariana Trench, I wouldn't be able to go there either. Isn't that right?
Cinderelik
Mister won't lie to you. If he says she's on the Moon, then Luna is on the Moon. As for how you get there...
Cinderelik takes a look at Vonnegut, and he nods in return.
Vonnegut
Voodoo... Maybe you should explain.
Right as he says that, a large shadow shrouds the three of them above their heads. The figure who eventually lands is the Transcendant "Voodoo".
Voodoo
Loki found an abandoned city 20 kilometers to the east where quite many Babylonian soldiers were gathering. After catching a soldier to investigate...
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiNoiseNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiNoiseNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiHuaping.prefab
Voodoo?
To play! Played with him until he spilled his secret! Then blood!
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiHuaping.prefab
Voodoo's voice suddenly becomes metallic and sharp. There seems to be some form of personality breakdown due to the M.I.N.D. defect of a humanoid-hybrid Construct.
Voodoo
There is an intact space shuttle underneath the ruins of that city. Those people are trying to board it to return to Babylonia—I believe that model is capable of traveling to the Moon.
Roland
I see. If we can get to the ship first, we can easily go for a joyride to the Moon.
Vonnegut turns back toward Roland. Roland cannot tell how Vonnegut feels underneath his mask.
Vonnegut
Luna is currently blocked by the Ascension-Network. She has lost the power of an agent, but not her status as one... It is a most peculiar situation.
Vonnegut
Her survival has certainly given humans an opportunity to cheat, which would hinder the Ascension-Network. That is why I want you to rescue Luna from the humans. And if she can't be saved...
Vonnegut nods at Cinderelik, signaling her to take out the prepared sealed case.
Vonnegut
Luna cannot be allowed to exist—not her body, not her mind, not even the idea of her.
Roland takes the case and opens it. Inside, he finds a container that is filled with crimson liquid, within which submerges a slice of constantly-mutation pale flesh.
Cinderelik
This is the remaining stem cell of the Hetero-Hive Mother who birthed the twins. It can grow infinitely by devouring all kinds of matter and energy.
Vonnegut
An unexpected byproduct, I'd say. It's not very intelligent, but it can tell friends from foes when controlled. That's good enough.
Roland
You want me to use this thing to remove Luna?
Vonnegut
You're correct. When you believe you cannot save her, or...
Vonnegut's golden pupils stare straight at Roland as he stresses his remaining words.
Vonnegut
...when you believe Luna, as an agent, is no longer worth saving.
Roland chuckles, putting the container back inside before holding the case.
Roland
When do I leave, then?
Roland asks Vonnegut, pretending to sound casual, but he is surprised to find Voodoo answering him.
Voodoo
Not "I." "We."
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory347.jpg
The white origami rabbit stands out in its charred surroundings. A hand gently lifts and carefully unfolds it, revealing the microscopic vessel of an encrypted message inside the paper.
The message is quickly read through. The vessel is then gently crushed by the hand, becoming one with the ashes on the ground.
She glances in the direction where the somewhat fresh footprints disappear before making her way east in haste.
Meanwhile, the unfolded origami is placed back onto the branch, its form once again a rabbit—
But perhaps the folds will never look as they once were.
